availability.p: The British Academic Spoken English (BASE) corpus was developed at the Universities of Warwick and Reading, under the directorship of Hilary Nesi (Centre for English Language Teacher Education, Warwick) and Paul Thompson (Department of Applied Linguistics, Reading), with funding from BALEAP, EURALEX, the British Academy and the Arts and Humanities Research Board. The original recordings are held at the Universities of Warwick and Reading, and at the Oxford Text Archive and may be consulted by bona fide researchers upon written application to any of the holding bodies. The BASE corpus is freely available to researchers who agree to the following conditions:
1. The recordings and transcriptions should not be modified in any way
2. The recordings and transcriptions should be used for research purposes only; they should not be reproduced in teaching materials

3. The recordings and transcriptions should not be reproduced in full for a wider audience/readership, although researchers are free to quote short passages of text (up to 200 running words from any given speech event)
4. The corpus developers should be informed of all presentations or publications arising from analysis of the corpus

Researchers should acknowledge their use of the corpus using the following form of words: The recordings and transcriptions used in this study come from the British Academic Spoken English (BASE) corpus, which was developed at the Universities of Warwick and Reading under the directorship of Hilary Nesi (Warwick) and Paul Thompson (Reading). Corpus development was assisted by funding from the Universities of Warwick and Reading, BALEAP, EURALEX, the British Academy and the Arts and Humanities Research Board.

body.u: a container of highly toxic liquid has contaminated the marked area in front of you if the liquid is not transferred to a safe container within thirty minutes then it will explode and contaminate the population of an entire city

the lives of thousands of people are in your hands inside the area you will find two containers one unsafe container holds the toxi toxic liquid the other safe container is available for decontamination you must not enter the contaminated area or the space above it or you will be removed for hospitalisation you must find a way to safely transfer the toxic liquid from the unsafe container into the safe container using only the materials provided to you for your group this includes four short pieces of rope seven feet long one long rope and a bicycle inner tube
it is vital that nothing or nobody touches the tape or the ground within it at any time during the operation the safe container may be moved anywhere in or outside the taped area

the unsafe container must stay inside the area and not be moved more than one foot from it's centre you may only use the equipment that you have been given you have thirty minutes to complete the task before the liquid explodes
you may only use the equipment you have been given you have thirty minutes to complete the task

# okay our three main points were planning communication and reviewing okay # within planning we thought the most important things to do were to delegate roles and make sure you had a leader or co-ordinators within your group to make sure that # everyone's point gets put across everyone can tell it to the leader and they can report back what they think also # you have to make sure you identify all the obstacles that could be possibly be put in your way and the key points of the instructions that are given to you and # under communication it's important to make sure that all those key points and obstacles worked out in the planning that everybody in the group understands them and # any plan that you put together based on those also that everybody within the group can put forward their ideas and communicate them to everyone else in the group so that everyone's aware of what's going on and reviewing # we decided it's not just what you do at the end it's like a constant process and you can keep changing your plan according to any problems that you meet that you didn't expect # that's our team work ideas

# our first point was fully understand the task and the rules # cause i think it saves time # it also saves you from breaking the rules which you know gets you disqualified and # and also it helps to get you involved in the task and so you know what you're doing and # particularly when you're doing the bucket and trying to pick the bucket and that you didn't know that you couldn't take it and put away from the centre or something like that and we had it managed to pick it up took it up and they said no stop and we finally read the rules so # also make a plan # so you can consider all possibilities # plan for the unexpected as well # with the blindfold one we didn't think well we probably should have done but we didn't think that everyone else would clap and so when you got taken away everyone else was clapping and we didn't have any idea where to go # you've also got to be flexible as well with your plan cause you don't know what's going to happen and also time management's quite important so you can work to the deadline and that's it
